oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Provost Marshall Pass for 16th Army Corps, US Army
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This is a Provost Marshall Pass from Pulaski, Tennessee allowing S. A. Smith and a team (of horses) to pass through Union lines and return within fifteen days. The pass is signed by H. L. Burnham by order of Brig. Gen. Greenville M. Dodge. Gen. Dodge's Division of the 16th Corps occupied portions of Middle Tennessee in the fall and winter of 1863. Dodge, with his headquarters in Pulaski, ordered the execution of Sam Davis for spying on November 27, 1863.
